intro: Freyliniopsis, commonly known as the dwarf sedge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are small, herbaceous plants native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Freyliniopsis species are often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where they thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Their botanical features make them valuable for ecological studies and habitat restoration projects.
